title: Nvidia (NVDA) breaks to new all-time high, what’s next? [Video]
text:
Elliott Wave Forecast Team

ElliottWave-Forecast.com Nvidia (NVDA) broke to new all-time high as we start 2024. The stock shows incomplete impulsive structure from the last significant low on October 31, 2023 low. The rally from October 31 is unfolding as a 5 waves impulse Elliott Wave structure. Up from October 31, wave ((1)) ended at 505.48 and dips in wave ((2)) ended at 450.10. The stock then resumes higher in wave ((3)) with internal subdivision as 5 waves. Up from wave ((2)), wave (1) ended at 504.33 and pullback in wave (2) ended at 473.20. Internal subdivision of wave (2) unfolded as a flat structure. Down from wave (1), wave A ended at 480.8 and wave B ended at 499.97. Wave C lower ended at 472.6 which completed wave (2).  Up from wave (2), wave 1 ended at 481.8, and pullback in wave 2 ended at 473.20. Stock resumes higher in a nest. Up from wave 2, wave ((i)) ended at 485 and dips in wave ((ii)) ended at 477.30. Stock resumed higher in wave ((iii)) towards 543.25 and pullback in wave ((iv)) ended at 530.18. Expect the stock to extend higher to end wave ((v)) of 3. Afterwards, it should pullback in wave 4 to correct cycle from 1.3.2024 low before it resumes higher. Near term, as far as pivot at 472.6 low stays intact, expect pullback to find support in 3, 7, or 11 swing for further upside.  FURTHER DISCLOSURES AND DISCLAIMER CONCERNING RISK, RESPONSIBILITY
AND LIABILITY

EUR/USD is clinging to gains above 1.0800 in the European trading hours on Monday. The US Dollar consolidates the previous week's upsurge, helping the pair stay afloat amid a mixed market sentiment. US data and Fedspeak stay in focus. GBP/USD is keeping its range near 1.2600 in the European session on Monday. The pair holds the bounce amid a steady US Dollar and lower US Treasury bond yields but the further upside appears elusive due to a tentative market sentiment. Speeches from BoE and Fed officials awaited. Gold price is trading modestly flat near $2,165, having paused the rebound just shy of the $2,180 level. A broad US Dollar consolidation mode leaves Gold price in limbo, as traders await more speeches from Fed policymakers for fresh hints on the timing of the first rate cut this year. This week’s outlook will be interesting as altcoin bulls try to go against Bitcoin’s bears. With an early Asian session pump in BTC, investors should ideally prepare for a US session sell-off. The Federal Reserve's preferred gauge of inflation promises fireworks. Fed Chair Powell and his prominent colleague Waller are set to speak during the week.
